data: When a man has reached the point where he can reflect, with cynical satisfaction, upon the brutality of organized society, and can contemplate unmoved one of its victims; and when the cause of his reflections is a woman not over thirty, whose worth and refinement are obvious to any reader of faces, that man either must possess a coarse-grained and cruel nature, or he must be very highly civilized.
Fee, Mary H. (Mary Helen); Sarka, Charles N. (Charles Nicholas), 1879-1960 [Illustrator]
